definition: weather/unstable situation
wind/news/style/custom/manner/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],絲|丝[si1]
cloud/CL:朵[duo3]
(classical) to say
surname Yun/abbr. for Yunnan Province 雲南省|云南省[Yun2 nan2 Sheng3]
the man (or woman) of the moment (idiom)/influential figure
changeable situation (idiom)
lit. to rebuke Heaven and Earth (idiom); fig. shaking the whole world/all-powerful
fortune as unpredictable as the weather, every day may bring fortune or calamity (idiom); sth unexpected may happen at any moment
pinyin: tian1 you3 bu4 ce4 feng1 yun2 , ren2 you3 dan4 xi1 huo4 fu2
containing_words.word: 天有不测风云，人有旦夕祸福

sentences.english: W2: The most important people in my country are definitely professional athletes.
sentences.chinese: 我们国家的风云人物当然是职业运动员了。

sentences.english: Whoso boasteth himself of a false gift is like clouds and wind without rain.
sentences.chinese: 空夸赠送礼物的，好像无雨的风云。

sentences.english: By autumn, however, clouds appeared unexpectedly.
sentences.chinese: 然而，一入秋天便风云突变。

sentences.english: Shit happens, especially when a newbie is "trying his best".
sentences.chinese: 天有不测风云，尤其是个新手在“尽力而为”的时候。

sentences.english: Did you watch the new movie called Overheard performed by Louis Ko…
sentences.chinese: 看过古天乐的新电影《窃听风云》了吗？

sentences.english: George Bush. Long time ago, he was the most powerful man in the world.
sentences.chinese: 曾几何时，他也是世界上叱诧风云的人物。

sentences.english: So we often can see the keyword of these caricature in a list of names posted up of wind and cloud .
sentences.chinese: 所以我们在风云榜中经常可以看到这些漫画的关键词。

sentences.english: No matter what changes take place in the international situation, this policy will not change.
sentences.chinese: 无论国际风云如何变幻，这一政策都不会改变。

sentences.english: THAILAND’S recent political history has been, to put it mildly, volatile.
sentences.chinese: 泰国近年的政治，说得婉转些，是风云变幻。

sentences.english: Thailand businessman Shi Li Hua , is the celebrity owning hundreds of millions assets on commercial circles.
sentences.chinese: 泰国商人施利华，是商界上拥有亿万资产的风云人物。

sentences.english: At that time the king called ZuYi, days of the contingency, made him very upset.
sentences.chinese: 那时的国君叫祖乙，天时风云的不测，使他很苦恼。

sentences.english: The following is a list of 5 Internet figures in 2010.
sentences.chinese: 下面让我们回顾一下本年度网络风云人物前五名。

sentences.english: It could put it in the bank and save it for a rainy day.
sentences.chinese: 公司可以将这笔钱存到银行，以防范天有不测风云。

sentences.english: Damn Homie, in highschool you was tha man, homie.
sentences.chinese: 哟，哥们，高中的时候你也算个风云人物呀。

sentences.english: Today, there is no excuse for not knowing what is going on in the markets.
sentences.chinese: 如今，已经没有理由不清楚市场上的风云变幻了。

sentences.english: In the turbulent, toss-about world of work, all kinds of people are worried about getting fired.
sentences.chinese: 在风云变幻的职场中，每个人都在担心会不会被炒。

definition: changeable situation (idiom)
to surge like a gathering storm (idiom)/to grow by leaps and bounds
to pursue deer/fig. to vie for supremacy
opportunity/chance
in large numbers/in force/lit. clouds bubbling up
to rebuke angrily
the man (or woman) of the moment (idiom)/influential figure
towering/lofty and steep (mountains)/extraordinary/outstanding
great changes

lit. warp and weft in weaving; vertically and horizontal/length and breadth/criss-crossed/able to move unhindered/abbr. for 合縱連橫|合纵连横[He2 zong4 Lian2 heng2], School of Diplomacy during the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
unrest (social or political)/turmoil/upheaval/commotion

rivers and lakes/all corners of the country/remote areas to which hermits retreat/section of society operating independently of mainstream society, out of reach of the law/the milieu in which wuxia tales play out (cf. 武俠|武侠[wu3 xia2])/(in late imperial times) world of traveling merchants, itinerant doctors, fortune tellers etc/demimonde/(in modern times) triads/secret gangster societies/underworld
fire beacon (to give alarm)
to talk freely
lit. the Big Dipper 北斗星[Bei3 dou3 xing1] has turned and the stars have moved/time flies/also written 星移斗轉|星移斗转[xing1 yi2 Dou3 zhuan3]
great heroes pursue deer in the central plains (idiom); fig. many vie for supremacy
